User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Rota Certa application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

userType.description: The type of user, either 'driver' or 'admin'.

email.description: The email address of the user.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number of the user.

Vehicle.title: Vehicle
Vehicle.description: Represents a vehicle in the Rota Certa application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Vehicle entity.

licensePlate.description: The license plate of the vehicle.

Checklist.title: Checklist
Checklist.description: Represents a checklist performed on a vehicle.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Checklist entity.

date.description: The date the vehicle was checked.

odometer.description: The odometer reading when the vehicle was checked.

status.description: Overall status of the vehicle based on checklist (e.g., 'Good', 'Needs Maintenance').

ChecklistItem.title: ChecklistItem
ChecklistItem.description: Represents a single item on a vehicle checklist.

id.description: Unique identifier for the ChecklistItem entity.

itemName.description: The name of the item being checked (e.g., 'left headlight', 'oil level', 'tire pressure').

notes.description: Any additional notes about the item.

MaintenanceRequest.title: MaintenanceRequest
MaintenanceRequest.description: Represents a maintenance request for a specific vehicle part or item, generated from a checklist.

id.description: Unique identifier for the MaintenanceRequest entity.

vehicleId.description: The ID of the vehicle this request is for.

checklistId.description: The ID of the checklist that generated this request.

itemId.description: The ID of the checklist item that has an issue (e.g., 'farol_esquerdo').

itemName.description: The human-readable name of the item (e.g., 'Farol Esquerdo').

reportedStatus.description: The status of the item as reported in the checklist (e.g., 'Avariado', 'issue').

requestStatus.description: The current status of the maintenance request.

quantity.description: The quantity of the item requested.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the request was created.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the request was last updated.

driverName.description: The name of the driver who reported the issue.

vehiclePlate.description: The license plate of the vehicle.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore data structure is designed to manage vehicle maintenance and checklists within the 'Rota Certa' application, focusing on security, scalability, and ease of debugging. The structure prioritizes authorization independence to avoid hierarchical `get()` calls in security rules, which can hinder atomic operations and complicate debugging.

To achieve Authorization Independence (Strategy A), the design denormalizes user roles into the vehicles collection. This allows for direct verification of a user's role without needing to fetch related user documents.

Structural Segregation (Strategy B) is applied by dedicating specific collections for different data types. This ensures each collection has a homogeneous security posture.

Access Modeling (Strategy C) uses a combination of path-based ownership for user-related data and membership maps for collaborative data (if needed in future versions). The `/users/{userId}/vehicles/{vehicleId}` path establishes clear ownership for vehicles assigned to specific users.

QAPs (Rules are not Filters) are supported through structural segregation, ensuring that list operations can be secured efficiently. The separation of user-owned vehicle data under `/users/{userId}/vehicles/{vehicleId}` allows for targeted list queries based on user identity.

The explicit modeling of vehicle and checklist states, combined with standardized naming conventions (Strategy D), enhances data clarity and predictability, which in turn simplifies security rule creation and maintenance.
